title: How to prove to myself that I am not the only thing that exists - Quora

response.answer_text: //Solipsism (/ˈsɒlɪpsɪzəm/ ( listen); from Latin solus, meaning 'alone', and ipse, meaning 'self') is the philosophical idea that only one's own mind is sure to exist. As an epistemological position, solipsism holds that knowledge of anything outside one's own mind is unsure; the external world and other minds cannot be known and might not exist outside the mind. As a metaphysical position, solipsism goes further to the conclusion that the world and other minds do not exist.// The concept was blocked from dissipating the actual self with the infamous and conclusive circular logic that “I think therefor I am.” //Descartes asserted that the very act of doubting one's own existence served—at minimum—as proof of the reality of one's own mind; there must be a thinking entity—in this case the self—for there to be a thought.// The idea that we are in reality a vatted lab rat on Neptune being hard-wired the ERTH-2050 program, mistaking it for reality exactly like our Neptunian Scientist masters intend…or that The Matrix was their way to introduce us to the idea that life is but their dream meant to consume the weak minds being duped and used…or The Universe is a hologram or computer program…or any number of other interesting scenarios that elaborate on solipsism, are fascinating and fun to mind game around with when first encountered, and for awhile… But entertained too long or given an excess of importance, and it begins to infect, swell and stupefy us like a tar-pit or drug habit or deification… Its a trap. Hank provided an excellent, necessarily and self-evident answer based on obvious evidence that we all do not revolve around you nor disappear just because you no longer see or are thinking of us. Anything you learn or discover is proof that you did not think it up or you’d’ve been already aware of it… The fact that you seek external opinions is evidence enough that you aren’t really buying into your own premise… The closest thing we can come to mind over matter actually creating the universe and everyone it…is in my experience, a prolonged and well controlled Lucid Dream…and real life is nothing even close.

Experience surprise. If it surprised you, it wasn't you doing it, right? Experience hunger or thirst. If you need something from outside, it's not just you, is it? Experience fear. If it scares you, makes you feel endangered, it's an outside threat, don't you think? And now you're trying to work out some mechanism by which these things could STILL be just you, right? Stop it. You're not the only thing that exists.
